heisig_chinese_memo: The taskmaster is always late, "Yea, I'm comeing, I'll be right there! Wheat a few seconds!"
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: If you eat lots of wheat, you'll grow up to have strong walking legs.
origin_of_ch_char_book: (‰æÜ, Êù•, lai, come) This character originally meant barley (È∫•, È∫¶, mai, wheat; barley). According to the ancient scripts, this character meant ‚Äúto receive holy barley.‚Äù In other words, it meant that heaven (Â§©, tian=t‚Äôien) gave barley to humanity; the sacred barley came from heaven. Therefore the character came to mean ‚Äúto come.‚Äù
humanum_full_description_en:
" Mai " Jia Jinwen from "Â§ä" (inverted " stop "), " come " sound. " Lai " is like the shape of a wheat, and then the word " zhi " is added under the word " Lai " to create the word " Mai " (" Zhi " is like a foot and has the meaning of walking) as the basis of the coming " Lai " word. However, because " come " is often borrowed to mean the " come " of coming and going, and the long vacation does not return, in the end the word "È∫¶" is used to mean rice and wheat (see Ye Yusen).

Oracle means wheat, "Collection" 24440: "food wheat." Also used as a place name. Bronze text also means wheat, which is seen in Zhong †≠Ø father plate, and is also used as a name.

"Said Wen": "Wheat, mang valley, autumn and thick twigs, so it is called wheat. Wheat, gold also. The king of gold is born, and the king of fire dies. Ever, those with ears; Congkui. All the wheat belongs to follow. wheat."
humanum_short_description_en: Synopsis: The Jia Jin inscription starts with "Â§ä" (pour " stop "), " come " sound. " Lai " is like wheat, and is the original word for "È∫¶". After adding the inverted elephant foot " dead " (ie small seal script, regular script of " additional information " shape), represents the arrival, so the " wheat " is " to present the word" due like wheat " to " being under the guise of arrival " " Come ", and did not repay it for a long time, so in the end the " Mai " created to express "come" righteousness means wheat.

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[‚ë†]Ôºªm√†iÔºΩ
["Guangyun" is not cut, enter the wheat, Ming. ]
Also known as "Mai 1".
(1) Annual or biannual herbaceous plants. The seeds are used to grind into flour, and can also be used to make sugar or wine. They are important food crops in northern my country. There are many kinds of wheat, barley, rye, oats and so on.
(2) The abbreviation of Maxwell.
(3) Last name. Sui You Mai Tiezhang. See the biography of "Sui Shu".
